result.execSummary:
The defendant Lois E Minnich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA and comply with any recommendations

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 1:02 P.M., Defendant, Lois E Minnich, appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Heather Douglas appearing telephonically, Probation recommends early discharge of probation, Agent states she has completed all recommendations, Atty Long objects to request as this was a joint agreement, Court denies request for early termination of probation, 1:11 P.M.
Agent Heather Douglas requests appear telephonically for Sept. 12 hearing - fax
